intro: Rudgea sipapoensis, commonly known as the Sierra Leone rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are usually opposite, with elliptical shapes and smooth surfaces. Rudgea sipapoensis is often found in shaded, moist environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
